(on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]) | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = |youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |youthyears2 = |youthclubs2 = [[Toronto FC Academy]] |youthyears3 = |youthclubs3 = [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] |youthyears4 = 2016 |youthclubs4 = [[Tooting & Mitcham United F.C.|Tooting & Mitcham United]] |collegeyears1 = 2014 |college1 = [[Toronto Varsity Blues men's soccer|Toronto Varsity Blues]] |collegecaps1 = 11 |collegegoals1 = 1 |years1 = 2016–2017 |clubs1 = [[Loughborough University F.C.|Loughborough University]] |caps1 = 11 |goals1 = 3 |years2 = 2017–2018 |clubs2 = [[Solihull Moors F.C.|Solihull Moors]] |caps2 = 45 |goals2 = 15 |years3 = 2018– |clubs3 = [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] |caps3 = 0 |goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2019– |clubs4 = → [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] (loan) |caps4 = 2 |goals4 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2017 | nationalteam1 = [[England national football C team|England C]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 |club-update = 09:51, 3 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Oladapo Joshua Afolayan''' (born 12 February 1998) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] on loan from [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. ==Career== Afolayan began his career in the youth system at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at the age of 9.{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/teams/development-squad/squad/oladapo-afolayan|title=Oladapo Afolayan|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|accessdate=23 February 2019}} At the age of 15, Afolayan moved to [[Canada]] and spent time in [[Toronto FC]]'s reserve squad as well as playing for [[Toronto Varsity Blues men's soccer|Toronto Varsity Blues]].{{cite web|url=http://www.oua.ca/sports/msoc/2014-15/players/dapoafolayanek8h?view=career&pos=kickers|title=Dapo Afolayan|publisher=Ontario University Athletics|accessdate=23 February 2019}} Afolayan also spent time playing youth football at [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] and [[Tooting & Mitcham United F.C.|Tooting & Mitcham United]].{{cite web|url=https://solihullobserver.co.uk/sport/from-toronto-to-solihull-the-rise-of-solihull-moors-striker-dapo-afolayan/|title=From Toronto to Solihull: the rise of Solihull Moors striker Dapo Afolayan|publisher=Solihull Observer|date=27 April 2017|accessdate=23 February 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/solihull-moors-boss-liam-mcdonald-12589903|title=Solihull Moors boss Liam McDonald delighted to secure former Chelsea kid Oladapo Afolayan|publisher=Solihull Observer|date=10 February 2017|accessdate=23 February 2019}} Afolayan returned to [[England]] at the age of 18 to study a civil engineering degree at [[Loughborough University]]. Afolayan played for the [[Loughborough University F.C.|university's team]] whilst studying, scoring three goals in 11 appearances for the club in the [[Midland Football League]].{{cite web|url=http://fulltime-league.thefa.com/DisplayStatsForPlayer.do?id=668152828|title=Total Motion Midland Football League|publisher=Football Association|accessdate=23 February 2019}} On 7 February 2017, Afolayan signed for [[National League (division)|National League]] club [[Solihull Moors F.C.|Solihull Moors]].{{cite web|url=http://www.solihullmoorsfc.co.uk/news/details.php?news_id=12556|title=Moors bolster strikeforce|publisher=Solihull Moors F.C.|date=7 February 2017|accessdate=23 February 2019}} Four days after joining the club, Afolayan scored on his debut, scoring the final goal in a 3–0 win against [[Sutton United F.C.|Sutton United]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38865490|title=Solihull Moors 3–0 Sutton United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=11 February 2017|accessdate=23 February 2019}} On 27 January 2018, Afolayan scored in his final game for the club, in a 3–1 win against [[Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.|Dagenham & Redbridge]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42756773|title=Dagenham & Redbridge 1–3 Solihull Moors|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 January 2018|accessdate=23 February 2019}} On 1 February 2018, [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] announced the signing of Afolayan on a three-and-a-half year contract.{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2018/february/01-february/west-ham-snap-forward-oladapo-afolayan|title=West Ham snap up forward Oladapo Afolayan|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=1 February 2018|accessdate=23 February 2019}} On 31 January 2019, Afolayan joined [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] on loan until the end of the [[2018–19 in English football|2018–19 season]].{{cite web|url=https://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2019/january/31-january/afolayan-joins-oldham-athletic-loan|title=Afolayan joins Oldham Athletic on loan|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=31 January 2019|accessdate=23 February 2019}} On 23 February 2019, Afolayan made his [[English Football League]] debut for Oldham in a 3–1 loss away to [[Bury F.C.|Bury]] as a 76th minute substitution.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47262317|title=Bury 3–1 Oldham Athletic|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 February 2019|accessdate=23 February 2019}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Template:Oldham Athletic A.F.C. squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Afolayan, Oladapo}} [[Category:1998 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Association football
